titleStmt.title: Co[m]mon places of Scripture ordrely and after a co[m]pendious forme of teachyng set forth with no litle labour, to the gret profit and help of all such studentes in Gods worde as haue not had longe exercyse in the same, by the ryghte excellent clerke Eras. Sarcerius ; translated in to Englysh by Rychard Tauerner.
Loci aliquot communes et theologici. English
titleStmt.author: Sarcerius, Erasmus, 1501-1559.
Taverner, Richard, 1505?-1575.

publicationStmt.publisher: By John Byddell dwellyng in Fletestrete at the sygne of the Sonne ouer agaynst the Cundyte,
publicationStmt.date: in the yere of our Lorde God M.CCCCC.xxxviii [1538]

notesStmt.note: Translation of: Loci aliquot communes et theologici.--Cf. NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
